course_title: American Legal Writing, Analysis & Research II
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 7Waitlist Total: 0 of 2
course_description: This course continues the study of legal analysis, research, and writing for practice in the American common law system. The topics covered include client letters, pleadings, and persuasive writing, along with enhanced instruction covering legal citation and advanced legal research sources and techniques. Note: International LLM students who want to sit for the Georgia bar exam must take this class.
sections: Class Nbr: 1698, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 2-3:15p, Instructor: N. Daspit, Status: Open
